page.title: 06ELECTRICITY
page.content: In{1979}a new{sub-station}was built in the south-end. Its purpose is to serve the community with electricity and it is surrounded by a tall wire fence.The{under sea cable,}carrying {33000 volts,}comes{from}the{power {station}in{Kirkwall}via{Shapinsay}and {Stronsay. Electricity is distributed around the island by{over-head wires}and the {supply of North Ronaldsay}goes{from {Sanday}from the Bay of Sandquoy. There are many ways a power cut can occur: snowy, windy or sleety weather and even crows' nests can cut off the supply. A small fault can be repaired by{Alan Simpson,the local Hydro-man. But if a more{serious fault}occurs men have to be{flown by Loganair}from Kirkwall. The repair of the wires could take from a few minutes to a few days.
